Home / Mapping

This is the Continuous Integration Build of the Phenopackets Implementation Guide, based on FHIR Version 4.0.0.

Mapping

This page describes the mapping between the original Phenopackets and this FHIR implementation guide. The general approach followed was to look at the attributes in the FHIR resources that matched the attributes in the Phenopacket elements and to flag those as mandatory to support (mustSupport = true). This, combined with a profile-aware API generator, can be used to create an API that is simple to use and compliant with the profiles.

Building Blocks

Phenopackets element Comment
Age Not needed because FHIR has its own age data type.
AgeRange Not needed because FHIR has its own range data type.
Biosample Corresponds to the Biosample profile. See notes.
Disease Corresponds to the Disease profile.
Evidence Corresponds to the evidence extension.
ExternalReference Corresponds to the external reference extension.
Gene Corresponds to ObsRegionStudied in the FHIR Genomics Reporting Implementation Guide.
HtsFile Corresponds to the Hts File profile.
Individual Corresponds to the Individual profile.
Karyotypic sex Corresponds to the individual karyotypic sex extension.
Metadata Not needed because FHIR already has its own metadata infrastructure.
OntologyClass Not needed because FHIR already has comprehensive support for terminologies.
Pedigree Corresponds to the Pedigree Node profile.
PhenotypicFeature Corresponds to the Phenotypic Feature profile.
Procedure Corresponds to Specimen.collection.
Resource Not needed because FHIR already has comprehensive support for terminologies.
Sex Not needed because FHIR already has the gender attribute in the Patient resource.
Variant Corresponds to Variant in the FHIR Genomics Reporting Implementation Guide.

Top-level Elements

Phenopackets element Comment
Phenopacket Corresponds to the Phenopackets profile.
Family ​Corresponds to the Family profile.
Cohort ​Corresponds to the Cohort profile.
Interpretation Corresponds to the GenomicsReport profile.

Notes

Phenopackets does not include the notion of an encounter, which makes it hard to store longitudinal information. This implementation guide uses the Encounter-Phenopackets profile to represent encounters.

In Phenopackets, a Biosample is meant to be “a unit of biological material from which the substrate molecules (e.g. genomic DNA, RNA, proteins) for molecular analyses (e.g. sequencing, array hybridisation, mass-spectrometry) are extracted.” However, the model includes additional information that goes beyond this definition, including cancer-related attributes.

In this IG, mCODE is used as the basis to model cancer-related resources. The profiles cannot be used directly because mCODE depends on USCore and the scope of this IG is international. However, the cancer-related profiles developed in this IG are closely aligned to the corresponding profiles in mCODE.

The following are the cancer-related profiles that were developed:

  • Primary cancer condition
  • Secondary cancer condition
  • TNM clinical stage group
  • TNM clinical primary tumor category
  • TNM clinical regional nodes category
  • TNM clinical distant metastases category
  • TNM pathologic stage group
  • TNM pathologic primary tumor category
  • TNM pathologic regional nodes category
  • TNM pathologic distant metastases category
